no.hig.hers.ludoclient

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.hig.hers.ludoclient.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player object is created when a new connection to server is accepted. player Object handles all the personal data of the player and the connection too the player on the client side.
    Author:
    Petter on 27.11.2015

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.net.Socket connection, int nr)
      Constructor that sets the socket connection and input and output for the player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.net.Socket connection,
              int nr)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor that sets the socket connection and input and output for the player. And sets the player to be host or not
        Parameters:
        connection - of the socket
        nr - of the player in the game
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if constructor can't be ran.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the buffered reader, the buffered writer and the socket connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if one can't be closed

      • sendText

        public void sendText(java.lang.String text)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Send the given message to the client. Ensures that all messages have a trailing newline and are flushed.
        Parameters:
        text - the message to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when sending the message

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Non blocking read from the client, if no data is available then null will be returned. Checks to see if a line can be read from the client and if so reads and returns that line (message). If no message is available null is returned.
        Returns:
        a String with message if available, otherwise null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the Player
        Returns:
        player name

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the player
        Parameters:
        name - of the player

      • getPlayerNr

        public int getPlayerNr()
        Gets the playerNr
        Returns:
        playerNr

      • getHost

        public boolean getHost()
        Checks if the player is hosting
        Returns:
        true if player is host, false otherwise
